campaign.story:
A Brand NEW book!
In 2014 and 2016, Kickstarter helped us raise over $400,000 for our first two books. We're back with a TOTALLY BRAND NEW BOOK filled with more artists, more excitement and more fun! We've been working hard since January 2018, and we hope YOU love it!  
Praise for 21 Draw...
Steve Rude - "An excellent guide from a stunning variety of top-notch artists. You will gain much from its study."
Loopy Dave - "The lineup is fantastic - full of artists who's work I admire. Very excited to be part of this new book!"
Charlie Bowater - "I loved the first book and this one is shaping up to be even better!" 
Lorenzo Etherington - "The new 21 Draw book will delve even deeper than the last in a collection of incredible process tutorials from the world's greatest artists."
Warren Louw - "The lineup of talent in 21 Draw is awesome! "
21 Draw as seen on...
 About the Book... 
Ever since our first book back in 2014, our backers, fans and students have been asking us for a "how-to" book that is focused purely on character design. Our first 2 books touched briefly on the character design process, but this new book is a really deep dive into the art. Character design is such a vast field, which is why it needs it's own focused, indepth book. 
We're working with an amazing line up of incredible industry PROFESSIONALS, and the book is jam-packed full of their combined experience, gained over their long careers. 
Design Example - Unofficial Cover
Design Example - "Character Archetypes" Chapter
 The Goal! 
Our goal is to help YOU be a better artist and have fun at the same time! We want to provide you,  both hobbyists and pros, with a better understanding of the WHOLE character design process. Most importantly, the book gives you the tools you need to produce unique and memorable characters. 
The techniques and tutorials included in the book help build your confidence and strengthen your knowledge of the art of character design, enabling you to successfully design for any project, and most importantly, in any style. And that's why we have such a wide array of artists with varying styles contributing to book! 
This is a book that we have dreamed of making for a long time and it is our biggest project to date. We're making a book that you'll love and cherish for your whole drawing career. YOU will love every page or else you'll get your money back! That's our promise to you.
"Gesture" Chapter
"Breaking the Rules" Chapter

Meet our artists!
LOISH: Lois Van Barrle (AKA Loish) is one of our favourite artists! She's an incredibly talented digital artist with a unique, dream-like style, and you're sure to have seen her work before. Loish has been working with us since 2014 and she always provides amazing work. We're so excited to have her on board again!
Loish!
Awesome Loish!

Tom Bancroft: Tom is a Disney Legend who's been involved in every single project we've done! He's worked on classics like Beauty & the Beast, Lion King & Alladin. His books like "Character Mentor" & others are required reading for many artschools in the world. So cool that he's up for another project :)
Tom Bancroft!
Tom Bancroft

Loopy Dave: Dave is another superb artist that we've been working with for a long time. He has an instantly recognizable style, and always contributes incredible, unique (and funny!) tutorials.
Loopy Dave

Part of Loopy Dave's artwork for our 1st book back in 2014!

Rene Cordova:  Rene is an incredibly talented character designer, art director and illustrator that we're working with for the first time. He's widely known in the industry, with an army of adoring fans! He has so many styles that it's impossible to even describe!
Rene Cordova!

Rene Cordova

Gerardo Sandoval:  Gerardo is a kick ass Mexican artist that we've also been working with since 2014. He currently draws for Marvel Comics and other big names. He always provides amazing contributions and his mastery of perspective is insane!
Gerardo Sandoval

Kenneth Anderson:  Kenneth is a professional character designer and illustrator based in the UK, whos forte is vikings, pirates and...welll...everything :) You'll learn tons of tricks from his superhuman skills in character based illustration and design! 
Kenneth Anderson

Kenneth's "Undead Pirate" tutorial for our last project.
Book Details
If you've backed our projects before then you know that we always use premium materials for our books. We believe that books are an artform in themselves and the presentation of the content is just as important as the content itself! In an age where reading has moved online, we want to bring back the physical feelings you get from holding a new, clean, crisp printed book in your hands, savouring every page.
"Character Archetype" Chapter
"The Tools" Chapter
 Stretch Goals
Stretch Goal 1: $135,000 (SEK 1,270,000): You get an awesome 4 Hour Character Design VIDEO Course!
Stretch Goal 2: $145,000 (SEK 1,365,000): You get a new artist in the book! We got some great suggestions for artists from you already and we're already contacting them :) But feel free to leave more suggestions in the comments section. It's always fun to hear who you guys like!
Stretch Goal 3: $155,000 (SEK 1,460,000): You get an awesome PREMIUM ART PRINT in the book, with art from one of our artists. We will choose the print after the kickstarter! :) Due to insane shipping costs, we can only offer this if you got the printed book. It will ship together with the book.
Stretch Goal 4:  COMING SOON! :)

More Incredible Artists!
Wouter Tulp: Wouter Tulp is a master storyteller, who has an instantly recognizable style. He worked on our very first book in 2014 and now he's back. In Wouter you'll get a seasoned pro whos passion and excitment are conveyed through his outstanding tutorials and designs. He's incredibly busy, so we're absolutely delighted he could get involved again!
Wouter Tulp
Wouter Tulp

CHAMBA: Jeffrey Cruz (AKA Chamba) loves drawing! And we love his drawings, especially when he draws in our books :) Chamba is a highly sought after artists who has worked for Marvel, D.C, Udon Capcom and Disney. He's also worked on our previous books and we can't wait for his new contribution!
Chamba!

Michael Bills: Michael is an incredbile concept artist with a really unique style. We've been working with him for a long time and he always provides exciting and fun contributions! His impressive character design abilities make him a real treasure on this project.  

Michael Bills


Rodgon: A gallon of life, a liter of cute and a twist of perv! Rodgon is an insanely talented artist who we're working with for the first time. There's a cool story about how we met, but we'll leave that for another time :) In the meantime, enjoy some of his crazy, unique skecthes. Bet you've never seen a post it like that before!
Rodgon the Artist!

Genzoman: AKA Gonzalo Ordonez Arias is a exceptional illustrator and fantasy painter whose impressive work makes anyone’s eyes cling to their screen. Well known for his work on World of Warcraft, his talents are a real asset to this project!
Awesome Genzoman!
Our Artists have worked for these folks!
Also available as an Ebook!

Learn about our previous books below...
We have limited copies of our first 2 books available in the upper teirs of the rewards. You can find some brief informaton about the books below.
Book 1 is our first crowdfunded book. It showcases over 1000 amazing images drawn by over 100 famous artists who have worked for companies like Disney, Marvel, Pixar, Dreamworks and more!  
Book 1
Book 2 is our second crowdfunded book. It is a broader book that touches on the many aspects of what it means to be an illustrator, including figure drawing, anatomy, environment design, perspective, coloring, character design and more!
Book 2 - Illustrator's Guidebook
Who is 21 Draw?
We are a group of international artists with headquarters in Sweden and main operations in the US, UK and EU. Our experience from our last projects means we have a great logistics system in place, so we can get your book to you as quickly as possible.
Guarantee! 
We're so sure that you'll love this book, that we're one of the few Kickstarters who offer you a 100% money back guarantee. If you don't love every page of the book, you can get a refund after 30 days from the date when you receive it. 

Backers are Best!
Our backers are the engnie that drives us to continue creating books and other projects. Our products simply would never exist if it was not for YOU. Back in 2014 you helped us create our very first book. Then in 2016 you helped us create our second book, Illustrator's Guidebook. 
You didn't only help fund the projects, but you also gave us the ideas for them. We have an amazing community of backers, and we've even met many of you "in real life" :) We'll continue to make products for you as long as you keep telling us what you want. A big THANK YOU!!! to everyone who has backed the project, and a massive thanks to all of you who spread the word!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk is making sure that we make the best possible book and get it to you on time. We learned alot from our last projects and have gained alot of experience. We also have a great network of top industry artists that we've worked with before and who can get great work to us on time! 

We've also set up an awesome logistics and production system so we can get all phases of your book completed and get it to you as quickly as possible. We have warehouses in the US and UK, a great book designer and premium printer and customer service teams waiting to get started. 

Most importantly, we've also started the production phases and have detailed schedules in place that will allow us to get your book to you on time. We are serious when we say that YOU will love every single page of this book or YOU get your money back. Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: End of project and other exciting news
updates.update_content:
Hey! It's Ryan here. 
At the end of every project I always like to do a summary of how the project went and talk about some lessons learned and how we can improve going forward. But first I want to thank you SO MUCH for supporting the project. These books would never exist without YOU. It's so cool to see you and the community get behind these big collaborative projects. 
I think this project went really well this time in terms of the content, and we are getting great feedback about that too. We are getting alot of Kickstarter emails and instagram tags with backers really enjoying the book. We also got some great feedback on how we can improve the content for future books, and we got some great suggestions for future artists, so for that.

Hey guys,
Great news! The books have started shipping :D 
Around 75% have been processed and shipped,  and the rest will follow ASAP. 
Please do me a HUGE favour. If you have questions, please send them to contact@21-draw.com instead of Kickstarter comments or kickstarter direct message. This is a HUGE help and helps us organize conversations and keep track of everything! We have a great customer support system set up there :) I'm working there too along with 2 other colleagues :D

Hey guys,
Just some quick info about the shipping. 
As you know, there have been alot of delays in international shipping due to the corona virus. We have worked very hard to find work arounds to this. Our target was to ship all the books in February and we almost pulled it off but there has been a slight delay. We're hoping that all of the books will be shipped by this Wednesday, and then you will get a tracking number where you can follow your parcel.

Hey Guys!
We just sent the surveys out. Please add your adress information to it as soon as possible. The sooner that we get everyone's address information the sooner we will be able to send you your rewards :) We need this information before christmas so as soon as you get this reminder please please pretty please add the your delivery info! 
Thanks so much for backing and I can't wait to send the books to you!

updates.update_userinfo: Please add your Address to the Survey
updates.update_content:
Hey Guys!
Here is some really important info about what the next steps are for our fulfilment plan! Just in case some of you are not familiar with Kickstarter I'll be as detailed as possible. 
Kickstarter will send the funds to our bank account this Friday, 5th July, and then we'll start with the first phase of fulfilment.

campaign.story:
Hello and Welcome to my 4th Enamel Pin Adventure! I hope you will all love this new series as much as I had fun making it!

Hello! I'm JunkYardRabbit, an Apprentice Tattooist, Digital Artist and Natural History Illustrator working on creating items to sell online. Floral Creatures was my first Kickstarter and was fully funded, as was my recent Enamel Pin, Magical Unicorns And Mystic Oceans!
This new series will feature my whale I Designed for my own skateboard, who is adorned with bones and will feature In this Enamel Pin Series. 
Stickers and additional designs will become available as stretch goals, and depending on how we go, I hope to also have patches made of the pin designs If we reach certain tiers.
All the pins will be (unless otherwise specified):
 Hard Enamel 
Gold Plated Metal 
 Rubber Clutch 
 High Quality 
 Include a backing card 
The pins will eventually be avalible via my online store  once the campaign is finished, though pins purchased in this campaign include a special kickstarter discount. 
https://www.etsy.com/au/shop/JunkYardRabbit
You will be able to choose your pin at the end of the campaign via a survey.
In addition to the current tiers available, you can add more pins to your pledge, so if you would like more than 5 pins, add money by clicking the "Manage" button next to your pledge, add to your total, then click "Change your Pledge".
More Pins will be added depending on how the campaign goes, as well as stickers being added. Keep an eye out for stretch goals being added!
$500 Goal
$1000 Goal
$2000 Goal
Cost Breakdown
April 1th -1st May : Kickstarter Campaign duration 
May  - June: Surveys sent (if Stretch Goals are met you can choose which pin/s you’d like if chose from that tier) 
June- July: Manufacturing is checked and completed, products are shipped to me and assembled to get ready for shipping! 
July-August: Rewards are shipped out! Please Note:
This timeframe could change to be slower or even quicker depending on how fast everything is processed and sent to me. I’ll try my hardest to stick to this time line and let everyone know if there are any set backs or if things have sped up!
If you would like to see more of my work please see the links below!
Etsy | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook | DeviantART |
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my Forth Enamel Pin series I’ve produced, so I feel pretty confident about the shipping and manufacturing times, But I’ve still given long timeframes for these to be completed. I’m confident in selling online as I have been doing it for some years now. If any other costs arise out of the campaign, I will use my own money to rectify any issues that may arise!

I’ll try and keep everyone as updated on the progress of things as much as I can and answer any questions that may arise!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! 
Just a quick update, all pins have been sent! They should start arriving within 3-6 weeks depending on your country! 
Thanks so much for the patience and support!

Hi everyone!
So sorry for the long wait for the pins to be shipped! I started to ship a few last month and then started to get pins from etsy sent back, as well as 2 from this kickstarter so ive had to launch an investigation into why a lot of packages wernt even making it out of Australia. I was so afraid if i sent all -f them id have to repay all the postage expenses, which i have with etsy ones. It is looking like its now sorted, the only thing is Australian Post shipping has gone up, but i will cover the extra myself. 

Once again, i apologise for the long wait and ill be shipping these out asap!

Hey everyone! 
I thought I'd show of how lovely the pins look on their backing cards! Im so excited for you to get yoir pins soon!

Hey everyone!
Just a visual update on the pins and shipping! I’m just putting the pins onto backing cards and will start sending out those without stickers next week and when the stickers arrive those will go out the following. I’m extremely pleased how amazing these look and I can’t wait until you get yours!
Thanks so much,

Hey everyone, I hope you're all well! 

The pins are currenrly being made and as soon as I get any photos I'll be sure to share them here! 
Thanks,

Hi everyone!
Productions almost ready to start as funds are now on their way! 
As wil the survey, for some reason I put the wrong pin, I put wave instead of dance, so anyone who puts wave down will in fact be getting the original diamond shaped on of the whales head. I will try and get the oceans wave pin made but It will be out of my own pocket, so keep an eye in my Instagram and Etsy for updates!

Hi everyone,
We have met 2 goals for pins! If we reach $1500, I'll be getting stickers made to go in everyone's packages! Please help by Sharing this project around to your social medias so we can hit the goal for the final pin! 
Thank you all so much for the support so far!

Hey everyone, 
Firstly, thank you all for the on going support, I really appreciate it so much! 
I just added some new reward teirs and the new pin design, so hopefully we can make that goal happen, but ill need everyones help with sharing this project to their facebooks and twitter and spreading the word so it will reach this goal!

Hello everyone! 
Thank you all so much for helping to unlock the First Stretch Goal! 
I'll be adding a new goal today and more teirs, so keep and eye out for that.
Please continue to share the project so we can unlock more designs, I'm really loving where this one is going.

updates.update_content: Almost all the packages have been shipped, the last of them will be shipped this week or next week!!

Packages with just pins will be sent out FRIDAY, June 29th.
Hoodies will be sent out next week! Thank you guys! I'll be making another kickstarter in a few weeks. Or maybe not!

ORDERED THE STICKERS AND THE HOODIES ARE BEING REDONE!!
2-3 MORE WEEKS AND I'LL HAVE EVERYTHING!!

Important:
Mew pins will come around next week!!
The defected hoodies will be put up for sale, new ones are coming in around June 27th.
Stickers will be ordered when the hoodies come in!

THE NGE HOODIES CAME IN THEY ARE DEFECTED!! I EMAILED THEM ALREADY.
The company is really slow on replying which is annoying, but I'm trying to replace one sweater for the Ancient Mew one. I can't order the holographic stickers yet and the Ancient Mew Pins are still not here since they're pretty big.
Anyone who didn't order stickers will get their NGE pin but that's it, everyone else's order will be delayed. :C
The NGE pins are coming Friday!!

The Ancient Mew pins are still in production, since they are big they are taking longer than usual. I have not asked for the NGE pin update but I will later and make an update on it.
The Ancient Mew Hoodies came in but they have an issue I'm not happy with, the front picture is blurry! I have already emailed them but it's the weekend, I don't expect an answer until Monday. If I don't get one by then I'll keep messaging them until I do.
The NGE Hoodies were ordered at the same time, I expected them to b with the Ancient Mew Hoodies but they were not with them! I have also emailed the shirt company about this.

I will be purchasing pins and hoodies today!!
They will be coming in 3 weeks!!

Surveys and messages have been sent.
In two weeks I'll get the funds from kickstarter and start ordering! I will be posting more updates when I get more information on the pins.

campaign.story:
Minor Blessings is an enamel pin set inspired by tarot and the Minor Arcana. The set consists of two larger 45mm pin designs and four 20mm pin designs.
45mm pins
Hard Enamel Pins
Matte Gold Plating
45mm (1.77 inch)
Backing Cards
Military and Rubber clasps
Snake's Blessing Pin - Careful planning lays the foundations to completion, though achieving it may require some prioritization. This pin wishes clarity upon the wearer, acuity to be used to slay ill omens, lay solid groundwork for personal endeavors, and for these projects to bring happiness to those around you. 
Crow's Blessing Pin -  Beginning a new venture is a realm of indecision. It can be daunting to embark on new creative endeavors, but hold tight to the origin of your inspiration. This pin wishes opportunities upon the wearer to give their ideas a chance to grow, and the aptitude of self love required to nurture and feed personal endeavors.  
20mm pins
Hard Enamel Pins
Matte Gold Plating
20mm (.78 inch) diameter small pins
Backing Cards
Military and Rubber clasps
Snake of Cups - A protector of emotions
Twin Crows - Balance of power
Snake of Wands - Endless inner growth
Coin Crows - Plenitude to be shared
Stretch Goals
$1500 - sticker sheets will be added to all rewards - UNLOCKED
$1800 - locking backs added to all rewards - UNLOCKED
Leftover earnings from this kickstarter will also be used to restock our Unkind Readings pins, which are also based on personifying each individual suit of the Minor Arcana.
Timeline
April - Kickstarting
May - Backer Polls & Product Count
June - Production & Shipping
Add-Ons
Unfortunately, we will not be handling add-ons during this kickstarter project. If you would like to purchase additional pins or other rewards, all leftover stock will be available on our Etsy Page after the project is complete.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our timeline for this project is shorter! To try to get pins to backers asap, we are doing this project for 15 days instead of 30 days. We greatly appreciate any signal boosts as they will be vital on this shorter timeline!

We are working with a manufacturer who has helped us to produce several pin designs already, and are confident in the speed and quality of their production. Designs may be tweaked to ensure the best outcome for the clarity and quality of the pin molds, and we will be sure to keep everyone updated on any design changes.

The portion of this process with the longest potential delays will be in the month of shipping. We will definitely be ordering shipping supplies ahead of time based on the success of the campaign, and our experience with a similar type of kickstarter has us confident we can overcome any hurdles thrown at us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Thank you again for your support with our Minor Blessings Kickstarter, we feel that it was a major break through for our creative and production process and your help with funding means a lot to us!
I'm here to announce our newest kickstarter, which is a sequel to our very first design set-- familiar feelings!

Hello everyone! We made it! Thank you so much, the last minute swell as very exciting to watch as the minutes counted down!
We've sent surveys for all reward tiers-- if you have any questions or concerns, feel free to message us or send an email to crowcouncilart@gmail.com !
In two weeks, we should have received funding and will be ordering pins-- we will be ordering some surplus just in case, but to ensure that you will get the pins you want, please send us your survey responses before then!
Short update! Sorry for the back to back messages-- we forgot to post the meanings of the stretch goal pins!

We did it! Ya'll did it! Thank you so much for your support, we've hit the 10,000 funding mark for our kickstarter!
Every backer will receive a free pin-- we've decided to go ahead and give everyone a choice between the two stretch goal designs however. So, those of you who love the dual snakes will get a chance to get that one instead!
As for anyone who wants both, we'll have surplus pins on our etsy after the kickstarter rewards have been sent out and everyone will get a chance to buy them there later.

We have one week left for our kickstarter campaign! Me and Cory worked on a couple more pin designs that we'd like to get made as stretch goals. Unlike our previous kickstarter campaign stretchgoal pins, these pins will be given for free to every backer if the goal is reached in addition to the rewards they already pledged to!

We are blown away! Both sticker sheets and locking back clasps have been unlocked for this kickstarter-- all backers will receive these rewards regardless of your pledge/tier! Thank you so much for your support for our project, we are so glad to be able to create these designs!
Here is the sticker sheet design-- it features the four mini designs, plus two unique sticker designs:

We're already past halfway there! Thank you everyone for your support and enthusiasm for the pins! We wanted to return closer to the origins of our design influences, and are emboldened to see that people are still interested in earlier concepts of our work. In the future, we're definitely considering expanding our original Familiar Feelings pins in a new project (yay more animals) and this has helped our confidence with that!
We've added two more reward tiers on request-- the mini set and big set! The mini set is all 4 small pins for $20 and the big set is 2 big pins for $20.

campaign.story:
Hello everyone! Grumpii is back with more grumpy looking dinos. My Grumpii have received  so much loves from the previous Kickstarter, so I decided to create more Grumpii. This time my designs are inspired by plants. I had so much fun creating these little Grumpii bois so I hope you will love them as much as I do. With your help your support I hope we can have all 5 Plant Grumpii designs unlocked by the end of this Kickstarter.
Follow us on @grumpii.art to see more Grumpiis!!!!
Kickstarter is risk free, it is all-or-nothing crowd funding platform. You can always increase/decrease or even cancel your pledge at anytime during the Kickstarter Campaign. You will only be charged when the campaign ends and the initial goal is 100% funded, which mean if the goal does not reach its initial goal of $300 by the time it ends, you won't be charged. 
Please note that you cannot change your pledge amount or add items after the campaign ends.
Even the stretch goal is locked, doesn't mean you can't pledge for it. Pledge for as many pins as you want, this will help fund the project beyond the initial goal and unlock the stretch goal for new designs.
Size: 2" (Height)
Plating: Gold Hard Enamel
Rubber Caps
Backstamped with Grumpii Logo
Leafy Tricy -  UNLOCK AT $300!

Autumn Drogoz - UNLOCK AT $600!

Mushroomsaurus - UNLOCK AT $900!

 Fly Trap Raptor - UNLOCK AT $1150! 

Flowersaurus - UNLOCK AT $1400!
This Grumpii will have Black Nickel Plated instead of God Plated
This is the breakdown of how the funds will be used for this project!
 Pin Production: 70%
 Shipping & Packaging: 20%
 Kickstarter Fees: 10%
 Mid April: Project begins!
 Early May: Kickstarter ends and it will take 14 days of processing funds.
 Late May: Production begins!
 Mid June ~ Late June: Rewards received and shipped out!
 ***You will receive a survey at the end of the campaign, this survey will let you choose which pins you like and also ask for shipping information.*** 
Thank you so much for taking your time stopping by to check Grumpii out!
My passion has grown for art even stronger and bigger because of the love and support you been giving to me.
Once again thank you very much for sticking with Grumpii. Follow grumpii.art on Instagram for more!!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There might be a few risks happen is items not shipping on time and manufacturing issues. I only created the designs for my pin, I do not manufacture the pins myself so the production time is out of my reach.

Please also note that the actual color of the product will be slightly different due to the color display of the monitor.

There's also the chance that designs may slightly be changed due to current manufacturing capabilities. (ex: some details might be too small for color fill, might need to be changed)

I will be updating if there any changes and process of the pin in the "Updates" section.

 I'm really confident that everything will go smoothly just like the previous project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Dames is a collaborative artzine, gathering 41 artists from all over the world around one theme: lady knights. 
Tired of bikini armor and helpless women in second roles, we - FlohGna and Trefle - wanted to create a space for badass warriors and their stories. Considering the quick interest the project gained, we think we weren’t the only ones who needed this!
Inside Dames, you will find 55+ exclusive illustrations, including sketches, processes and all the merch visuals designed for the Kickstarter.

Each artist created an original piece we hope you’ll enjoy as much as we do!




The zine is 21x29,7cm (A4, 8,3x11,7inch) with a matte finished hardcover and 72 pages.
Both the front and back covers were lovingly illustrated by Natto, the layout art was created by Robofeather, and the assembling and graphic design was made by graphic designers FlohGna and Trefle.
It is ready to go, and as soon as we have the funds, we will launch the printing process!






Every physical order comes with a 15x15cm (5.9inch) print of our social media main visual, illustrated by FlohGna and reworked slightly for the printing, as well as a 21x29,7cm (A4, 8.3x11,7inch) print with gold foil of the back cover by Natto. They also include a 15x21cm (A5, 5.9x8.3inch) stickers sheet by Prinsomnia.


They will also receive four postcards, with random visuals selected between all the zine illustrations! 

All our prints will be printed on matte-finished 350g paper.

Fencer, (Dawn) Duellist, Longswordist, Sword Maiden and Shield Maiden pledges will receive five 15x21cm (A5, 5.9x8.3inch) prints:
three metallic foil illustrations, by Formyths, Natto and Aadorah 
six illustrations
Featuring art from Fiona Marchbank, Cindy Zhi, Amelia Allore, Nor, Ken J and Caitlin Ono.
Please note these visuals are exclusive to the premium pledges, and won't be postcards! 






They will also include a 35mm soft enamel pin designed by Foxflight Studio.



And a 15x21cm (A5, 5.9x8.3inch) print with its assorted stickers sheet by Yudi Chen, as well as two 10cm (3,9inch) vinyl stickers by Willow and Robofeather. 



Limited editions rewards! - SOLD OUT

Longswordist, Sword Maiden and Shield Maiden will receive a 21x29,7cm (A4, 8.3x11.7in) limited edition risograph, printed in three colors on Munken paper. They will be signed by the artist, Clémence Gouy.
Please note this visual is a risograph exclusive and won't be a postcard!




There are two different pledges with 14,8x21cm original artwork (A5, 5.8x8.3in).
For each pledge, we will contact backers in chronological order (from first backer to last) asking for their preferred illustration details.

There are two categories:
 one with inked illustrations, with gold or silver accents. Artists include Amagoia Agirre, Eren and FlohGna. 



 and the other with a black inked diptych with gold accents and watercolors illustrations. Artists include Prince Arsonist, VickyPandora and Trefle. 

















The zine will be printed only once. After the Kickstarter, zine artists might sell a few copies on their online shop, but it won’t get printed again.
Once the taxes and fees, rewards printing and shipping, as well as artists copies + shipping are paid, the benefits will be split among the artists.


If you want to support us,
Simply choose your reward and enter the total amount you wish to give to our project. Please note that Kickstarter only charges at the end of the campaign and you can change your pledge at any time during it!



Shipping fees are 12€ for everyone, no matter where we’re sending the order.
It does not include tracking, except for the pledges Longswordist, Sword Maiden and Shield Maiden.
If you wish to have insurance and tracking, you need to add 20€ to the amount you wish to pledge. In case your order goes missing or arrives damaged, we will send you a new one. If you don't get the insurance and tracking option, we won’t be held responsible for a lost or damaged order.
Orders will be sent from France, so they might take a while depending on your country. We will notify you once your order has been shipped.
All orders will be sent in cardboard envelopes. The book will be wrapped in a plastic sachet for further protection.



The zine, merch, and digital files are ready to go, and as soon as we receive the Kickstarter funds, we will launch the printing and production process!
Digital rewards will be sent in September 2019. We estimate the first physical orders to be shipped in August 2019. Depending on the number of orders, it might take longer, but we’re planning to be finished by November 2019.
We will update you regularly!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re confident about the project, but if we don’t fund the Kickstarter, we’re planning on releasing it later on as an A5 zine with a soft cover and less goodies through pre-orders. Dames will exist, even if it’s smaller! 

We’re not safe from production or shipping problems, so if there are any delays, we will warn and update you. 

We need your support to make this book come to life and we hope everyone will be as enthusiastic as they were when we first announced it!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New Kickstarter has launched! Dames, Warrior Women of Legends
New book! Dames, Warrior Women of Legends
updates.update_content:
Dear backers and followers,

If you follow us on our social media, you know we've been working for a few months on a new Dames!
As you might have seen on our social media, we're launching our online shop today! It will be open during a month, so until March 14th.

Between Monday to today, we’ve shipped every order! Make sure you check your mailbox!
Thank you again to everyone who backed the project, we can’t wait for you all to receive the book and merchs!

updates.update_userinfo: About damaged packages and shipping issues
updates.update_content:
Hello!
As we’re very close to shipping everything, we thought we’d make you wait a bit by showing you pictures of all the different goodies!
If you missed our Kickstarter, you will be able to order some leftovers on our online shop in February, as well as directly buy some of the merch from our artists. We will update you with links on where to find everything.

Hello!

As we’re getting closer to shipping everything, we have now officially close the reward surveys. If you still haven’t send yours, or need to change it, it’s now too late to do so.
We will most probably ship everything in beginnings of October, so slightly delayed, apologizes for this. We had a few troubles with our merch and producers, and sadly don’t have the choice but to wait a bit.

Digital rewards have been sent!
Make sure to check your Kickstarter e-mail to get the download link!
If you haven't received it, please reach out to us in private message with your e-mail address, and we will send it to you again.

campaign.story:
The aggressive rejection of any nude artwork (and specifically the female nipples) on social media has influenced creators to the extent that many artists now avoid working with nudity altogether. Posted uncensored, their work has led to blocked profiles, deleted images, and platform bans,  creating an industry stigma around the subject that artists are now cautioned to avoid. #hardcover is taking a stand; publishing explicit artwork created by established professionals who believe in the freedom to explore our sexuality and humanity through art. With artists like Kim Jung Gi, Sara Pichelli, Bastien Lecouffe Deharme, Daniela Uhlig, Belén Ortega, Even Mehl Amundsen, Gerald Parel and many many more, this book promises to be one of a kind!
We opened the entry phase for the second book #hardcover2. You can submit your work under this link: https://upload.hardcoverart.com/
Even here on Kickstarter, promoting a book celebrating sexuality and the human form, we cannot show you the beautiful art contained within. We share the sentiment of sadness as we have no other option. The campaign would get rejected for anything but extremely cropped images, to a level where showing them defies the purpose of their creation. Check out the edited previews and let your imagination complete the picture, for now…


Most of the artists contributing to #hardcover haven't published any adult art until taking part in this project, which makes this volume an exclusive window into their intimate thoughts. We wanted the artists to be free to create any content without boundaries, so the book contains expressions of all sexualities - and we wouldn't want it any other way. The book will be bound as a black hardcover (duh!) and have 160 pages of content. 
We have the work of over 120 artists in this project. The cover will feature a copper-foil logo, and we have a Kickstarter-exclusive tier that adds a sketchbook that is showing alternative work, processes and sketches, and also includes a slipcase.  
This is a project that was built together with a lot of democratic decisions, pushing the limits of everyone's creativity, even outside the creation of the works themselves. As such, every artist will be compensated with a part of the profit. We want to be clear that by supporting this project you are also directly supporting the artists.  As the publisher of artists like Kim Jung Gi, Karl Kopinski, Jesper Ejsing, Claire Wendling and the Superani Group, Éditions Caurette has a wealth of experience in fulfilling books like this and making sure they arrive safely at every backer's home.
In case you don't have a credit card to back the project, please reach out to us on orders@hardcoverart.com

During the campaign we will be having a contest! You can win a stack of artbooks! Worth over 1200€ and additionally some of them will have sketches by the artists. 
Sketchbooks from KJG: 2007 / 2011 / 2013 / 2015 (Omphalos) / 2016 / 2018 + 1 Sketch
Jesper Ejsing: Elsewhere
Karl Kopinski: The Big Kopinski
Claire Wendling: 3 sketchbooks + 1 Sketch
Even Mehl Amundsen: Tegn 1, 2, 3 + prints
Sleeping Beauty
Terryl Whilatch: Principles of Creature Design, Science of Creature Design, Animals real and Imagined
Eric Canet: Encore - Deluxe Edition
Send us your entry until the campaign's end (over the easter celebration) on the 29th of April, to win this huge stack of books (OMG it is so big!). What we want you to create in any medium you prefer:
We purposefully left it pretty open to leave you a broad spectrum of possibilities. No specification for style, gender, medium or anything else. Give us your idea of a sexy (or not sexy) bunny, but make sure that it is SFW (Safe For Work) and that it can be posted everywhere online. The character(s) must be depicted interacting with our book in some way. It can be read, burned, sit on a stack of it, or just thrown in the corner, but it must be visible that it is #hardcover.
Post your piece on social media with the hashtag #hardcovercontest and make sure that it has the format A4 (210x297mm) in 300dpi, RGB and as a JPG in portrait format. Send your finished piece to contest@hardcoverart.com. Entries that arrive after the campaign's end cannot be considered for winning. 
You don't have to be a backer to participate. So good luck! :)

We would have loved to show you images of the products, but using this platform comes with a price for all of us, which means that to actually use it, we aren't allowed to share the products with you. So they will be a surprise, and you have to trust us :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the content and layout is finished. The only thing that is missing is the actual printed products for which we are running this campaign.

The fulfilment will be handled by the busy bees at Éditions Caurette who have great experience in publishing and cheap shipment to buyers of high quality print products. They have been publishing works of artists like Kim Jung Gi, Jesper Ejsing, Karl Kopinski and many more, so we trust their competence and judgement. 

Shipping of the products will be untracked, except for the highest tier which will have items unique to this campaign and will demand a higher fee to make sure nothing gets lost. In case of problems with the shipping of the other tiers, Éditions Caurette will be there to answer your questions.

We don't expect any delays but of course we will update you all if there are any unexpected changes or unforseen developments as we work fully transparently.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Just in case you didn’t watch the calendar, the deadline is approaching! You still have until the 16th of October to upload your work so it can be considered for the next volume of hardcover:
#hardcover3
And this time we are including a little difference to this, which is #softcover3!
Hey dear supporters, we have some great news for you.

Dear backers,
I want to personally thank you for your patience in regard of the many shipments that took a while to arrive. Only two days ago a friend's book arrived in India and even though I am happy that it didn't get lost, I thought about how happy I am that we found a good solution for the next campaign. We will have tracked shipping for a reasonable cost as a standard shipping method, so nobody will have to wonder where their book is and what happened with it.

Dear backers,
I would like to take a moment and address something I can no longer tolerate. Our team has been receiving rude messages packed with slurs and insults, because of some very impatient backers, mostly from overseas. You can be sure that behavior like this won’t make any difference. It also doesn’t help to send a message on a Saturday and send question marks and angry messages on a Sunday because there has been no reply over the weekend. I appreciate every patient question about the whereabouts of their pledge, this is absolutely fair and encouraged (especially by DM). But the screenshots I have gotten from the Caurette team go absolutely too far and I cannot grasp the reason for such actions.

updates.update_userinfo: #hardtober and the last (hopefully) update on shipping
updates.update_content:
I got good and bad news. 
Bad: The flu struck at Caurette's office and two of their little helpers had to step back and get better, which caused the 2-day delay. It is that time of the year it seems, get your shots!
Good: Thank you for your patience! Today all books, aside from a couple left for France and those who had address changes and other complications, were shipped. Yes, that means that all the tracked shippings have left the office and you should either already have the tracking number or get it tomorrow or whenever the shipping company of your country sends it over.

Hey everybody, we have some news on the shipments. 
The regular books and prints will all be out by today. It took a bit longer than estimated and hopefully that didn't cause you guys any problems. Between printers jumping the ship, stickerdudes jumping the ship too and the occasional madness we are happy to have some certain good news for you and you can be certain that the book will arrive at your place, one way or another. For EU-backers: Before you get worried about the book not arriving and you message us, give it time until Oct 1st and if there are still issues, we are happy to help. In the meantime we are happy about everyone telling us that the book arrived and we are very much looking forward to your feedback about the book!

updates.update_userinfo: A little update on tracked shipping
updates.update_content: In short: Most of the books are out, a couple of them that go faaaar away will be managed this week, so if you would like to add tracked shipping to them (outside of the EU) you can contact hardcover@caurette.com and for 30€ they can add the tracking to the shipment (if it hasn't left the warehouse yet). In the next campaign we will do this a bit differently with cloned products but different shipping methods. You never stop learning :) Please make sure to add all the information in the email that they would need to make sure they are talking to the right person and find your pledge. Thanks!

Dear backers,
we are getting comments and questions specifically asking when the shipments will arrive in which country. We have no specific information about this. The logical answer is that it takes longer the farther away your country is from France. 
We are working on finishing all shipments this week. Backers who pledged on the 100€ tier (the special edition) will receive a link with a tracking number as soon as the shipment is processed. Please check your spam folders for this.
Not much left to say aside from this quick update :) Hit me up at Lightbox Expo if you want to take a look at the books :)

campaign.story:
GREAT NEWS! Every reward backer who has pledged for 1 pin or more gets the Kickstarter Exclusive Kitsune Mask pin completely free! Check out the 'Stretch Goal' section for more information!
Hi, I'm Kayleigh! Thanks for checking out my 2nd Kickstarter project! 
The key theme of this project surrounds Japanese festivals. All of the pin designs are based around different icons that I have seen at temples and shrines during festivals, such as Daruma dolls at New Years, and the ubiquitous Lucky Cat. I have intertwined this with a starry night sky aesthetic as I always loved visiting these festivals after dark, feeling buzz of excitement and seeing the sky lit up by fireworks. The last key theme is cherry blossoms, with both plum and light pink sakura represented, as it was always my goal to visit during this really special and fleeting season. What I've essentially done is created a set of eight pins that represent my perfect festival, which I hope you will also love too. 
Above are the three designs that are automatically unlocked when this Kickstarter hits it's goal of £900! These will all be between 2.5/3cm in height, cast in gold-coloured metal with hard enamel colours, and will feature a butterfly-clip back! 
1. This represents a type of Japanese amulet called Omamori. They're often made of fabric and feature scripture on the front detailing the type of good fortune it brings. 
2. The Lucky Cat, or Maneki Neko. I'm sure you've seen these incredibly popular little kitties!  It's right paw is raised to bring good fortune in the form of wealth!
3. A paper fan, inspired by the kind often used in traditional dancing! 
EDIT! - Every reward backer who has pledged for 1 pin or more will get the KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE Kitsune Mask enamel pin! Pictured in the campaign banner. The kitsune fox mask is often seen at shrines, with some even being dedicated solely to these creature! Foxes were seen as messengers for the god Inari, and Kitsune can be good or evil depending the situation! This enamel pin was added on as an extra stretch goal to say thank you to everyone who has pledged! 
First stretch goal is unlocked! This is a Daruma doll, often seen around New Years festivals. You colour in the first eye when you set a goal you wish to achieve for the year, and then you colour the second eye when you have completed it!
Second design is unlocked! This is an Ema, a wooden plaque that is often seen at shrines. Sometimes you can buy them with printed designs, but you'll normally see them clustered together with different prayers left on them. You can normally write your own too!
Third design is unlocked! Lanterns are seen all over Japan, from welcoming visitors into festivals through to inviting guests into restaurants. There are even festivals held around the country surrounding lanterns themselves!
Fourth design is unlocked! This one depicts an origami crane; this is a symbol of hope in Japanese culture, and it's said that you wish will come true if you fold 1000 origami cranes. This is also a homage to the first enamel pin I created, which will be discontinued after this Kickstarter (you can see it further down the page!).
Final design is unlocked! This one is of a Japanese Koban coin; these coins date back to Japan's feudal era and are now often seen being held by Maneki Neko (lucky cats) to bring luck in the form of wealth or as little charms. This design features the main phases of the moon along with the cherry blossoms. This design will look like an amulet or charm as it will mostly be gold! You may also recognise this coin from the character Meowth in Pokemon. 
ORIGINAL TEXT!
Ah yes, stretch goals. If this Kickstarter reaches it's initial funding goal, there are five stretch goal targets to hit that unlock five more Japanese Festival designs! Each will be revealed when the target that precedes it is hit! 
e.g. The first stretch goal design will be revealed once the Kickstarter is funded, and the second design will be revealed once the first goal is funded, etc.
So it's very simple, you get to choose from the unlocked pin designs for your reward! 
Example 1: We unlocked 3 designs and you pledge for 2 designs, you get to choose which 2 you want.
Example 2: We unlocked 4 designs and you pledge 5 designs, you get to choose from the unlocked 4 designs, so you can choose doubles of certain designs.
Remember, the funding does not go through until the project time is finished. So you can alter your pledge at any time, so you can add on a pin for a stretch goal design if you like it! 
I have a limited number of First Come, First Served rewards which offer a little bit of money saved, these are limited to 5 per reward.
If I come up with any more stretch goal ideas then I'll update ASAP on here with the details! On my last project we ended up adding another pin after all of the stretch goals were met which became a Kickstarter backer exclusive! 
If you have any questions about the above, please let me know! 
This handy little pie chart gives you a quick idea of the cost breakdowns that have to be considered with this project.   
MARCH - Kickstarter launches! 
APRIL - Kickstarter ends! The funds take roughly 2-3 weeks to arrive on my end so I'll send out surveys as soon as I can!
MID-LATE APRIL - Send out surveys to you guys, so you can choose which pins you want! Then I put in the pin order! The pins take roughly 1-1/2 months to produce.
JULY - I will receive the pins! I check every single one to make sure they're in perfect condition. I then package them and begin posting towards the end of the month.
AUGUST - Your pins will begin arriving! UK backers will get them first I assume as I'm in the UK, but the rest of you around the world will get them too!  
As I said in the beginning, I'm Kayleigh! I'm a UK based illustrator who has spent quite a bit of time visiting Japan over the last few years, and am now launching my 2nd enamel pin badge Kickstarter project, so I can not only relive my most treasured memories in my own way, but also so I can share my creations with others who might like this concept too!
Check out my last Kickstarter project: Japanese Konbini Store Enamel Pins
Check out my Etsy Store: The Art of Kayleigh Causton
I will be using the same enamel pin supplier as I used for my last Kickstarter and my previous pins, as I believe in the quality of the product, the excellent turnaround times and reliable delivery. 
Here's some pics... 
Here's my social channels, I'll be posting a lot about the Kickstarter but you'll also be able to see more of my work on there too! 
Instagram: @kavon_kayleigh
  Tumblr: thisiskayleigh.tumblr.com
  Twitter: @kaylescau
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The designs are complete. 
I have chosen my suppliers carefully for the pins, packaging and postage; all suppliers that I have used before more than once.

The only risks are that the pin supplier does not reach the high standards I expect of them, or that the delivery of pins fails to reach me, or that the pins fail to reach you.

As I mentioned above, I have selected a trusted pin supplier that I have used more than once to deliver the highest-quality product with excellent turnaround times and delivery. 
If the pin delivery fails to reach me for some reason then I will keep you updated immediately with all the information I have. 
If the delivery does not reach you then just simply contact me and we'll look into rectifying any issues.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Hello everyone, it's been a while!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, it's been a while - perhaps a year?? Wow!
I hope you are safe and sound out there in the big world, it's been a year  and I want to send my best wishes to everyone.
I also wanted to reach out to share a little Black Friday offer I have put live on my website.
I have a few enamel pins left from this campaign, and my previous one (a more pink, kawaii themed one!) so I've made a few grab bags.

Hi everyone!
I have excellent news, yesterday (Saturday) I managed to post EVERY SINGLE ORDER in one batch! Which means that your order is now on it's way! Wahey!
For the last Kickstarter I sent everyone an individual message to say whether it had been shipped because I had to split it all into two batches, but as every single reward backer's shipment was sent on the same day, I will not be sending individual messages as there isn't really a need.
So... when will you receive it?

Hi all,
I know it's only been a few days since I last uploaded but I had to hop on and update you on the situation.
I managed to package everyone's orders on Saturday which was great, but unfortunately I did not manage to post any of them today (Sunday) due to my two closest post offices BOTH being closed. =( They're both usually open on Sundays but unfortunately they were closed today because of some parade closing roads in town.

updates.update_userinfo: They have arrived & they are being sent!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Great news, the enamel pins have arrived and I'm so pleased with how they look! The colours are so vivd and the gold trim looks so lovely. They arrived this week so I've spent the last few days inspecting all of them and popping them onto their backing cards, and they're ready to ship!
My plan is to package and ship them all this weekend, so you will receive a message from me on Sunday to confirm if it has been shipped.

Hi all,
I hope you're all well! This is just a small update but I wanted to keep you all in the loop; the enamel pins took a little longer than anticipated to make due to my supplier having a large amount of work to get through, but they are now on en route to me! 
Therefore, once they arrive I will do a quality check on every pin before sending them out, and I will update you on their arrival.

Hi all,
Hope everyone's doing well! 
Just posting a quick update to say thank you all so much for getting back to me so quickly with the surveys - it really made everything so much easier for me to organise! 
I have since received the funding for the project and have successfully placed the enamel pin order! The pins should hopefully arrive within 1 month so I reckon they will reach me by end of May at the latest. If there are any issues then I will keep you updated along the journey. I have also placed an order for the pin's backing cards, which will arrive next week.

Hi everyone!
It's over, we did it!! We unlocked every stretch goal including the free exclusive Kitsune Fox enamel pin for every backer!
I have sent out the reward surveys to all of you, if you could PLEASE send this back with your choice of rewards ASAP; that would be amazing. Kickstarter estimates that the funds will reach me in about two weeks, and I want to make the enamel pin order as soon as it arrives.

Hi everyone!
To say thank you to all of you for supporting this campaign so far, I have added an extra unlocked stretch goal which gives everyone who has pledged for at least 1 pin a free Kickstarter Exclusive Enamel Pin that is only available to you guys!
The pin design can be found on the main campaign banner; it's a Kitsune 'Fox' Mask! I hope you all like it, and I want to say again a HUGE thank you to all of you for supporting this project!

Hey everyone,
The 5th stretch goal has been unlocked! So you can now choose the Koban coin enamel pin for any of the reward tiers!
I know this is said in every update I publish but thank you all for the incredible support, and for helping to make this project happen! The final number needs to stay above £2150 for all of the rewards to stay unlocked, and we have 8 days left! So please, please keep sharing the project with everyone who loves enamel pins!

project_data.project_name: Japanese Sakura Night Festival Enamel Pins

campaign.story:
Hello!  My name is Marisa and I'm a full time freelance artist who enjoys cute things as well as spooky things and weird stories!  I enjoy cryptozoology so much so I thought I would combine that with my passion for drawing cute creatures, and so Cuddly Cryptids are born!  Adorable versions of the cryptids we know and love.

Although I would love to just bring these cuddly creatures to you, pin production is expensive, so I am hoping you can help bring these cuties to life and into your hearts (and on your bags, jackets, etc)!
These will be hard enamel pins, with either silver or gold plating depending on the cryptid!  Pins will be roughly 1.5inches tall and come with two rubber clasps on the back for extra security!  Each cryptid will also come on their own backing card with the 'Cuddly Cryptids' logo.

Like a cryptid that has yet to be discovered?  Don't wait!  Back this project now to unlock your favorite cryptids!  You can change your pledge at any time and will not be charged if the project fails to be funded!
Not able to pledge at this time?  That's okay!  You can still help out by sharing this project with friends and family! 
Bigfoot: You've probably heard of the Sasquatch or Bigfoot.  The elusive North American furry cryptid that leaves larger than average footprints.  Seen multiple times by travelers who don't dare get too close but are able to capture blurry photos of this little guy.  We think he's just camera shy.
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 
Nessie: The Loch Ness Monster or 'Nessie' as she is lovingly nicknamed originates in Scotland.  If you ever visit the Loch Ness on a misty morning make sure to keep your eyes peeled, you may catch Nessie playing in the water!
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 
The Jersey Devil: From New Jersey, USA the Jersey Devil is the youngest of his family with twelve older siblings!  The Jersey Devil likes to spend his free time playing with other kids~
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 

Mothman:  Mothman is a cryptid from West Virginia, USA.  He has been reportedly seen flying around at night.  We assume he just likes basking in the moonlight~
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 
Chupacabra:  Chupacabras are thought to kill and drink the blood from livestock, but this simply isn't true.  Chupacabras actually protect livestock from coyotes and other predators.  They've also been seen cuddling with the livestock.
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 
Dover Demon: The dover demon was first reported seen in Massachusetts, USA.  Not much is known about him.  He seems very skiddish and we hope he hasn't been scared away for good!
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 
Flatwoods Monster: Another cryptid originating from West Virginia, USA.  Flatwoods monster is very gentle and kind.  She can sometimes be seen on nights of meteor showers.
Cuddleability: ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥  ♥ 



Kickstarter exclusive!  Every pin order will receive one FREE sticker to go with their pin!  If you pledge for two pins, you get two stickers, three pins, three stickers, etc!
Don't wait for a cryptid that's undiscovered to become discovered!  Help in the search to find your favorite cryptid and pledge now!  You can change your pledge at any time and if the campaign isn't funded you are not charged~


March - Early April: Kickstarter is live!
Mid April: Kickstarter ends and backers are charged.
Late April - Early May: Pins are put into production
Late June: Pins shipped to me.  Each pin is inspected for quality.
Late June-Early July: Pins are packaged and shipped to you!

campaign.story:
Each of these pins features the skull of a native California animal with a corresponding native plant.
(I know kelp is an algae, not a plant -- shh!)
- Hard cloisonne enamel
- Gold tone metal
- Approx. 30mm x 30mm (about 1.25")
- Rubber clutch backing
$1+ - Thank you!
Even if you can only spare a few bucks, I appreciate every penny! Thanks for helping get this project off the ground!
$10+ - Choose One Pin
Have a favorite? Pledge at this level for a single California Natives pin in your choice of funded designs.
$20+ - Choose Two Pins
Can't decide? Pledge at this tier, and you'll receive two California Natives pins of your choice. Keep them both, or share with a friend!
$30+ - Choose Three Pins
You know the drill. Pledge at this level, and you'll get three California Natives pins in your choice of funded designs.
$40+ - Choose Four Pins
It should come as no surprise that at this tier, you'll receive four California Native pins of your choice. Collect all four designs, or get multiples of your favorite!
February - Kickstarter launches!
March - Kickstarter ends! If successful, pins go into production. Once the designs are approved, manufacturing takes about 4 weeks.
May - I receive the pins from the manufacturer and begin the laborious (but joyful!) process of shipping them all to you!
June - Barring any production delays or shipping mishaps, everyone should have their pins in hand by early June!
60% - Pin production! Pretty self explanatory -- this covers the nitty-gritty of getting these pins manufactured.
25% - Shipping! This covers the costs of all shipping involved -- from the manufacturer to me, and then from me to you!
15% - Safety buffer! This is to account for Kickstarter fees, payment processing, dropped pledges, and any miscalculations or unforeseen expenses.
My initial goal of $300 covers manufacturing, shipping, and Kickstarter fees for an order of 100 coyote skull pins. For every additional $300 raised after that, another design will be unlocked! Any money raised beyond these stretch goals will go towards increasing my order quantity.
Hey all! Thanks for checking out my humble Kickstarter!
My name is Molly Alice Hoy, and I'm an illustrator and indie designer based in LA. As of last year, I work full-time running my Etsy shop, Gold and Mean, where I sell products like jewelry, apparel, and everyone's favorite -- enamel pins! I love designing new things to stock my store, but turning these designs into real live products often means meeting order minimums that can easily run hundreds of dollars. As an indie artist, it's rare that I have that much disposable cash in one place at any given time!
In 2017, I turned to Kickstarter and successfully funded my first pin design. By the end of the year, I had successfully funded two more campaigns -- my Arcane Animal pin series followed by my Star Fawn pin set. After a year off, I'm excited to get back in the game and fund my latest set of designs! 
Your Kickstarter pledge not only scores you a cool pin (or two! or maybe three!), but it also helps directly support me and make my dream of an indie art career possible. Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The fact that this is a small project with a modest goal mitigates a lot of the risks and challenges that other projects face. Having run three successful Kickstarters already, not to mention placing frequent product orders for my Etsy shop, I have a pretty good idea of what I’m in for. On top of that, I’ve done my best to allot generous buffers in both my budget and timeline to account for any oversights or mishaps that might arise during production and shipping. And of course I’ll be sure to keep my backers up to date in the event that any such mishaps arise!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
You read that right, folks -- pins are currently in production and preorders are now open in my Etsy shop! How it all happened is a bit of a tale that will have to wait for another update. For now, though, I guess this has just been a lesson in Trusting Myself™ and Not Giving Up™ because you really never know how things might pan out in the end!
To thank you, my beloved backers, for being with me from the beginning (and to mitigate some of Etsy's inflated shipping costs) you can get 20% off your preorder with code CAKS19. I expect preorders to ship sometime in mid-May, so really we're right on schedule, if you think about it!
Thanks again to all of you for your support! It's been a roller coaster, but I'm really excited to get these pins made and into your hands!

Hi all! 
As you've no doubt noticed, I've decided to cancel the California Natives pin set campaign. This was for a number of reasons, the main one being that this campaign hasn't gained the traction I would have liked in order for me to fulfill my original vision, that is, to get all four pins made as a complete set.
That's not to say that the campaign couldn't have pulled it back in the final few days or hours -- stranger things have happened on Kickstarter -- but after some deliberation, I arrived at the conclusion that it was a better move for me to potentially disappoint a handful of backers than to stress about how I was going to fill in the funding gaps myself.  Ultimately, I decided that my time, money, and energy would be better spent towards building and strengthening other aspects of my business.
We did it -- the first pin design is unlocked! Thanks so much for pledging to bring these pins to life. I can't wait to get the rest of them funded!

Hi there! ( ´ ▽ ` )ﾉ My name is Shirley and I'm a Black and Korean full-time independent artist living in Central California with my 18 year old iguana Ness, and my German Shepherd puppy Eden. 
For my 16th Kickstarter campaign, I wanted to scale back a little after my previous mega pin campaign, and am looking to fund my beautifully designed 구미호 (Kumiho) pin.
 What is a 구미호 (Kumiho)? 
A 구미호 (Kumiho/Gumiho) is a nine-tailed fox from Korean folklore. 구미호 have the ability to shape-shift and often take the form of a beautiful woman to seduce men so they can eat their hearts or livers (Don't worry! My pin will capture your heart - not eat it). 

 I've now had 15 successful Kickstarter campaigns (including the original campaign that started the enamel pin Kickstarter trend). And my latest campaign successfully hit $11k in funding for 31 separate enamel pin designs and a risograph artbook.
Here's a compilation of my previous campaigns! ( ´ ▽ ` )
For the first time I'm offering a sticker stretch goal! If unlocked, all single pin (or higher) backer tiers will receive a free 구미호 vinyl sticker with their reward!
A sticker tier will also be made available to backers who wish to purchase a sticker.
NEW STRETCH GOALS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is now my 16th Kickstarter campaign so I'm rather seasoned when it comes to running a campaign, fulfilling rewards, and working with manufacturers. ٩(ˊᗜˋ*)و

I will warn that we may run into some delays in regards to pin manufacturing. 
The past year we've had some issues regarding quality which ends up causing minor delays. But in the end, I've always been able to get the quality of product I want. 

Pin quality issues have been happening much more frequently I feel that it's now appropriate to mention delays may happen, and should be expected, as a precaution.

I heavily pride myself in making sure I stay upfront and transparent when it comes to communicating with my backers. I like to keep everyone in the loop in regards to whatever's going on, including when we may run into issues.
And I've got a wonderful track record on ensuring backers get their rewards in a timely manner.

campaign.story:
Hi everyone! Thank you for checking out my campaign. Following the success of my previous Kickstarter campaign, and after receiving multiple requests from fans and players to launch a new one, I've decided to do exactly that. I'm offering all new playmats and prints featuring my latest work, in exchange for donations towards my feature film project called KIN Fables: The Stolen Child.
For newcomers, my name is Seb McKinnon and I've been illustrating for Magic the Gathering since the M13 core set. For a full catalogue of my works, I invite you to check out this link here. 
And if you haven't seen it already, I highly recommend this video essay from Rhystic Studies exploring my work for MtG.
I also direct films and videos through my production company, Five Knights productions, and I make music under the name CLANN.
What's so special about these playmats/prints?
I'd like to offer you something special. Here's how I'm doing that for you: 
 Limited Edition - This will be a one-time printing only. In other words, once this campaign is done, I will never reprint these playmats or prints again. EVER. The amount I produce will depend on the demand. For example, if 100 people pledge for a Bedevil print, there will be only 100 produced (for playmats however, I need to print in increments of 50). 
 Minimal Logo presence on the playmats! The Planeswalker symbol and Wizards of the Coast and Ultra-Pro logos are mandatory on official playmats. No way around it. However, Wizards of the Coast, Ultra-Pro and I worked together to make the logos as unobtrusive as possible for you, looking more like watermarks in placed in 2 corners of the mat.
  Signed playmats and prints for everyone! 
 These items have purpose. 100% of all funds raised during this campaign go towards funding my film (after shipping and playmat/print production costs). 
 Unique, extended artworks - To avoid cropping of any kind, I have painted expansions to each artwork. This way, the art you love remains whole, and you still get a playmat with art that reaches all the way to the edges! Take a look at the example below. 


TEAMING UP FOR THE SHIPPING PROCESS
To help me take care of shipping, I've teamed up with the wonderful people at HitPoint Press, the team behind Cubeamajigs, Cardamajigs, The Deck of Many and soon Humblewood, so you know you are in really good hands!
We are offering 2-5 day expedited shipping with tracking with Fedex, and regular post to P.O. Box addresses. 
PLEASE CHECK THE F.A.Q. FOR MORE INFO ON THIS CAMPAIGN! :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've gone through all this before and have learned a lot from the last campaign, so this one should run even smoother! The only risk is a longer waiting time for your items due to circumstances out of my control. For playmats, Ultra-Pro needs an 8 week production time. Which means that when this campaign ends, I will need all backers to answer the surveys as soon as possible and choose their artworks, so that I may send that information to Ultra-Pro. So if we move quickly together, you could possibly get your packages in July. I added 2 months for safety in case of hiccups, which explains the September delivery date. 

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to send me a private message, or leave a comment! 

Thank you all! 
-Seb
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Story
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my campaign!  I am a designer that truly has a passion for pins.  They give life and purpose to what would otherwise just be little sketches in my book that no one would ever see.  With your help these tiny works of art can serve their true purpose of inspiring those who see them and helping people express themselves.  
Thank you for helping me bring magic into the world one design at a time.    
Last January I had a campaign for a Black Bird pin design, and that design became one of my favorite pins!  It had mysterious feel about it and a striking look thanks to the rhythm of the line-work in the wings.  
Since then black birds have been a commonly sketched subject for me.  One year later, I am ready to share some related designs I have been working on and to build on that aesthetic and subject matter through a series of pins I am calling Black Feathers!  And don't worry, the original black bird pin is available as a reward for those who missed out on it the first time around!
Designs Insights
Each design is made with hard enamel and silver colored metalwork.  They each have two post/rubber clutches on the back to hold them securely in place and prevent spinning.  
Encircled - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches wide and features several open cutouts.  This noble, yet mysterious bird haunted my sketchbook for many months until I finally got it to look how I wanted.  I absolutely love this design and cannot wait to see it come to life!
Shielded - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches tall and was originally designed as part of a series of celestial guardian pins that I am considering releasing in the future.  His keen eye is ever watchful over you, lending you the ancient wisdom of his kind when you need it most.
Moon Flight - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches wide and is the inspiration for this project.  This design was originally Kickstarted in January of 2018 and remains one of my favorite designs.  For me it represents freedom as his flight traverses the moon.  
Black Feather - Unlocked
This design is ~2 inches from tip to tip.  I have always loved the aesthetic of feathers.  Whether they were loose feathers found on walks, or stately looking writing quills, I just love them.  I tried to embrace a feather's elegant simplicity in this design.  
Fated - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches tall and 1.75 inches wide.  I am an avid gamer and love to show my support for the table top community.  This beautiful, yet fearsome bird has found an enchanted D20.  Shall he roll for your fate?  For those of you who are not gamers, perhaps he has happened upon a beautifully cut amethyst?
Left Wing and Right Wing - Unlocked!
Each of these designs is ~2 inches from tip to tip.  I have seen many others do their take on feathered wings.  What I find so interesting is the huge diversity in how they look.  Some are very realistic, others are heavily stylized.  I was going for something in between.  A primary goal I had in designing these was to make sure the rhythm of the feathers 'felt' right to me when I looked at them.  I am very sensitive to minor variations in things like this and I spent a considerable amount of time making tiny little adjustments that most people will never notice, but in the end I achieved a design that satisfied my inner sense of harmony.   Please note that the Left Wing and the Right Wing are considered two separate pins so you would need to pledge for two pins to get a set.   
Wand Keeper - Unlocked!
This design is just shy of 2 inches from wand tip to tail feathers.  The Wand Keeper is the head of a bird council who are interested in advancing the magical arts among birds.  Sure they have had to 'borrow' a few things to get the job done, but they fully intend to repay those who have 'donated' to their cause.  
Ebon Gryphon - Unlocked!
This design is ~1.75 inches from wing-tip to toe.  Don't let the dark feathers fool you, this noble creature is as pure as any of his kind.  Gryphons of all kind symbolize strength, courage, and leadership.  His pose was inspired by the 'rampant' attitude which gryphons are often seen in in European heraldry.
Knowledge - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches tall.  I woke up one morning with most of this idea flitting around my head.  I put down a rough version in my sketch book but when I looked at it I felt like it was incomplete.  A while later the idea to hang a key around his neck came to me and when I added that element it was like the entire piece just clicked into place.  This piece screams symbolism to me, but I do not know what it means.  Whatever message it speaks to you is for you.  
King - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches tall.  I have always had a love of playing card art, especially the court cards.  I can remember as a child flipping the king of clubs over and over to see if they had made any mistakes in his mirrored art.  I really wanted to play with that classic look and this seemed like a great opportunity.
Queen - Unlocked!
This design is 1.5 inches tall.  What would a king be without his queen?  This design posed an interesting challenge.  First I had to make sure the design felt different than the king, but also they needed to compliment each other and feel like they were of the same world.  Second I needed to find ways to suggest ideas of femininity.  The Queen design easily took twice as long (if not longer) than the king.  
T-Shirt Add-ons
To celebrate this project hitting over 100 backers I took my two favorite of the pin designs and will be having t-shirts printed for myself.  
If you want a t-shirt too you can add $25 to your existing pledge for each shirt you want. They are unisex  (mens) sizes XS through XL  I will get the details (what size and design you want) from you in the backer survey at the end of the campaign.  If you have any questions please send me a message!
Mockup of t-shirt designs.
About Frost Dragon Designs, LLC
My name is Joshua R. Pinkas and I am the creator and owner of Frost Dragon Designs, LLC. After years of working on projects for others through freelance work and private commissions, I decided to start building something for myself and started Frost Dragon Designs, LLC.  
I am a seasoned pin creator and have designed, had manufactured, and delivered thousands of beautiful enamel pins.  
All of my designs are my own original creations. I start my creative process with traditional drawings in sketchbooks. Even the simplest of designs will usually go through a dozen or more revisions before I recreate it digitally and prepare the files to send to my manufacturers.  
I love launching new projects and designs on Kickstarter because this is where I got my start with my company, and because I have found a wonderfully supportive community here who genuinely care about creatives.  
Every pin you back helps fund the production of new original designs!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am a designer, not a manufacturer, so I have to trust my manufacturer to execute my designs at a high level and on time. There could be production issues that are beyond my control that could impact the delivery date. Also minor changes in the design may occur to prevent manufacturing problems, but these will only be made if it is absolutely necessary and every effort will be made to preserve the original aesthetic.

Additionally, though shipping logistics could always potentially be a problem, I have reliably shipped thousands of pins via USPS.

If any issues arise I will be sure to notify backers.

Please note that everyone's monitors display images a little differently. The colors shown for the pins may vary slightly when compared to the pins in person.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
